oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Bobby Bare Interview by Bob Allen 1-24-80 Tape Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Bobby Bare by Bob Allen. The interview takes place on 1-24-80.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bobby Bare;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Tape Two, Side One - (0:08) -- Bobby Bare discusses working with Chet Atkins and his desire to record high-energy music that he can perform live. (2:49) -- Bob Allen asks Bobby Bare about his early childhood. (4:46) -- Bob Allen asks Bobby Bare about his father's occupation. (6:58) -- Bob Allen asks Bobby Bare about his mother's passing. (8:16) -- Bob Allen asks Bobby Bare about his childhood jobs - such as driving an ice cream truck. Bobby Bare mentions that he worked at a garment factory. (10:06) -- Bob Allen asks Bobby Bare where he got his strong drive to succeed in the music business. (13:16) -- Bobby Bare speaks about his first demo session that earned him a record deal with Capitol Records. (14:22) -- Bobby Bare tells a story about mistakenly dropping a quarter into a jukebox. Bobby Bare thought it was a cigarette machine. (15:35) -- Bobby Bare speaks about the trouble of finding his first hit in California. Bobby Bare worked in a Long Beach club for three-four years. (16:27) -- Bob Allen asks whether Bobby Bare has nostalgia for California. Bobby Bare mentions that the thought of going back depresses him. (19:04) -- Bobby Bare explains why he didn't want to write for Warner Brothers TV shows. (19:58) -- Bob Allen asks when Bobby Bare first moved to Nashville (1964). (20:32) -- Bob Allen asks whether Willie Nelson lived with Bobby Bare in California. (22:29) -- Bob Allen asks Bobby Bare what Willie Nelson was like when he lived with him in California. (24:02) -- Bob Allen asks Bobby Bare if he still fishes often.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Bare, Bobby;
